documentHeader.documentDescription: DNP3 Device Profile for the opendnp3 library (master / outstation)

methods.note: Opendnp3 is a source code library for implementing masters and outstations. Implementers integrating the library should supply their own device profile specific to their device.

other.explanation: source code library is configurable via configuration structures. Configuration via file is done by the integrator.

currentValue.note: C++ library supports arbitrary physical layers by implementing IPhysicalLayer interface.

capabilities.note: Depends on target hardware
Depends on target hardware.
Type of serial support depends on target platform.
TCP keep-alive values are determined by the target operating system.
Opendnp3 does not support UDP. UDP is only useful for small DNP3 messages inconjunction with BROADCAST functionality.
Opendnp3 is extremely scalable. The number of connections supported depends on your OS and OS configuration.
The default address in the library depends on the whether is a master (1) or outstation (1024)
Outstation supports multiple CROB/AO. Master does not.
Incremental timeout shares the same response timeout. The timeout timer begins after reception of a confirm frame.
Immediately times out requests for off-line devices with a distinct result code independent of the command codes.
Master library has no special distinction for "off-scan".
Control retries are not supported. These can be implemented as different sequence # requests at the user layer.
Scheduling the time bit is an outstaion application concern. A method is provided to set the IIN bit, and callbacks are there to receive time write requsts.
A method is provided to set the the Device Trouble bit.

eventBufferOrganization.capabilities: Max events is configured per object group
eventBufferOrganization.currentValue: Max events is configured per object group

Integrator defined.
roll-over is defined by the user application. default rollover is 32-bit representation.
Octet strings are supported by the master. They are NOT supported by the outstation.
